item.title: Capcom is Offering Huge Discounts on Xbox 360 Games
item.description:
Highlights

  • Capcom offers Resident Evil and Devil May Cry titles for under $2 on Xbox 360 before the marketplace closure on July 29.
  • Xbox promises major discounts as the store shut down nears, with two waves of discounts already available.
  • Fans were disappointed by the lack of certain Capcom games in the sale, but more titles may be added in the final wave next month.

Capcom has given its fans an opportunity to grab a number of its past titles, including several Resident Evil and Devil May Cry entries, at heavily discounted prices on Xbox 360 . Last year, Xbox sadly announced that it'll be shuttering its 360 Marketplace in July 2024, warning gamers that all digital titles in the Xbox 360 store will become permanently unavailable after July 29.

Thankfully, Xbox isn't letting the 360 store go out without a bang, as it's promised a wealth of major discounts to hit the marketplace as July 29 approaches. Two waves of discounts have already hit Xbox 360's digital storefront, which has seen titles like Tomb Raider , Watch Dogs , Far Cry 4 , and Thief become available for just a few dollars. Xbox is planning a third and final update in July, which will see another large batch of 360 games be sliced to mere pennies on the dollar.

With just over a month to go until the Xbox 360 Marketplace shuts down, Capcom chimed in with its contribution to Xbox 360's big blowout sale. Capcom highlighted a list of some of its biggest games from the 360 era, all going on sale for no more than $1.99. A number of entries from Capcom franchises like Dead Rising , Resident Evil , and Devil May Cry populate the list. Even titles like Bionic Commando (2009) and Don's Nod's Remember Me have joined the mix.

Discounted Capcom Games On Xbox 360 List

  • Bionic Commando - $1.49
  • Bionic Commando: Rearmed - $0.99
  • Darkstalkers Resurrection - $1.49
  • Dead Rising - $1.49
  • Dead Rising 2 - $1.99
  • Dead Rising 2: Off the Record - $1.99
  • DmC Devil May Cry - $1.99
  • DMC HD Collection - $1.99
  • Devil May Cry 4 - $1.99
  • Resident Evil 0 - $1.99
  • Resident Evil 4 - $1.99
  • Resident Evil 5 - $1.99
  • Resident Evil 6 - $1.99
  • Resident Evil - $1.99
  • Resident Evil Revelations - $1.99
  • Remember Me - $1.99
  • Street Fighter 2 Turbo HD Remix - $1.49
  • Street Fighter 3: 3rd Strike Online Edition - $1.49
  • Street Fighter X Tekken - $1.99

While the pricing of these older Capcom games is certainly satisfactory, many fans expressed their disappointment at the low number of Street Fighter games included in the list. Street Fighter X Tekken , Street Fighter 2 Turbo HD Remix , and Street Fighter 3: 3rd Strike Online Edition are the only titles from Capcom's juggernaut fighting franchise to be included, leaving fans wondering about Street Fighter 4. Additionally, Dragon's Dogma , which has become more popular than ever thanks to the release of Dragon's Dogma 2 this year, is also missing. Despite an already long list of discounts, it's entirely possible that Capcom could be planning to add even more of its games as part of Xbox's third and final wave of discounted 360 titles coming next month.

While many major Xbox 360 games have been discounted as part of the Xbox 360 store's final months, there are certainly still a lot of big, important Xbox games missing from the sale. Not a single Halo , Forza, or Gears of War title appears on the current list of discounted Xbox 360 games. It's likely that some titles from these tentpole Xbox franchises will show up in the Xbox 360 sale next month as the store's July 29 closure approaches.

item.title: Witcher 3 Studio Congratulates Elden Ring for Shadow of the Erdtree Achievement
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree surpasses Witcher 3's Blood and Wine as the best-rated expansion ever with an average rating of 94.
  • CD Projekt Red congratulates FromSoftware for its "stellar work" on the highly acclaimed Elden Ring DLC.
  • Despite critical acclaim, some players face issues with Shadow of the Erdtree DLC on Steam Deck, but FromSoftware is working on a fix.

Witcher 3 developer CD Projekt Red has congratulated Elden Ring studio FromSoftware for the latter's Shadow of the Erdtree overtaking the former's Blood and Wine and becoming the best-rated expansion ever released. The new Elden Ring DLC refreshes the game's content with a new story campaign, new weapons, new enemies, new locations, and more.

Back in 2022, the fantasy action RPG game from veteran game director Hidetaka Miyazaki came out to commercial as well as critical success, bagging multiple Game of the Year awards. Elden Ring has since gone on to sell more than 25 million copies, and its highly anticipated DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree , has also hit the ground running.

According to OpenCritic, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree is now the highest-rated expansion in history. As a result, it has also toppled The Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt 's Blood and Wine DLC as the highest-rated DLC for an RPG, a distinction that CDPR's game had held for the past 8 years. The Elden Ring DLC holds an average rating of 94 based on 63 critic reviews as opposed to Blood and Wine 's average rating of 92 based on 78 critic reviews. In a tweet via The Witcher 's official Twitter account, CDPR gave its congratulations to FromSoftware upon Shadow of the Erdtree 's successful launch and praised the studio's "stellar work."

Shadow of the Erdtree DLC Achieves Massive Critical Acclaim

The flurry of outstanding reviews means that Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC now ranks above even the best-rated full-fledged games released so far in 2024, such as Final Fantasy 7: Rebirth and Balatro , which have average OpenCritic scores of 93 and 91 respectively. Moreover, the well-received expansion is just a single point shy of base game Elden Ring 's average rating of 95 sourced from 205 reviews.

Even though Shadow of the Erdtree is currently available for all Elden Ring owners to download and play, not everyone is having the same seamless experience. Recently, FromSoftware tweeted that it was actively working to fix a major bug that renders Elden Ring unplayable on Steam Deck after the latest update. While the Japanese developer didn't reveal when it will roll out a fix for this issue, based on its prompt response, fans may rest assured that they will be able to experience the next chapter in the journey of the Elden Lord sooner rather than later.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers
  • Episode: Echoes Seasonal Challenges
  • Exotic Mission Rotation
  • Raid and Dungeon Rotation
  • Raid Challenges
  • Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit
  • Legacy Activities and Challenges
  • Dares of Eternity Rotation
  • Xur Details
  • Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Updated June 21, 2024: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. The content roll-out for The Final Shape continues this week as Destiny 2 's first 12-man activity, Excision, launches a Grandmaster difficulty version. Bungie has promised that this version will not only be difficult, but it also teased that the reward for finishing it will "totally be worth it."

Alongside Excision, the Dual Destiny exotic mission continues to divide Destiny 2 fans. As the only way to unlock the previously revealed exotic class items, many praise Bungie for adding a completely unique and interesting activity to the game. However, there are those who feel the exact opposite, frustrated that the only way to unlock these unique exotics is through a forced cooperative activity.

In addition to all of that, the Destiny 2 weekly reset is back again, bringing refreshed content, activities, and rewards. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of June 18, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : The Disgraced

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Barrier and Unstoppable
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Arc, Void, and Solar.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Glaive and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Fire Pit : When defeated, Acolytes spawn fire pools that cause damage over time.
  • Threat : Arc
  • Surge : Arc and Void

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Chaff : Radar is disabled.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

Grandmaster difficulty arrives on June 25.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Undercurrent (Legendary Grenade Launcher)

Vanguard Ops Elemental Surge : Arc and Void

Vanguard Ops Elemental Threat : Arc

Episode: Echoes Seasonal Challenges

Week 3

  1. Scratch the Surface II : Complete Act 1 Part 2 of "A Rising Chorus."
  2. Research and Development II : Complete the research quest for Specimen ID: NES002.
  3. Aggressive Exploration I : Complete Episode Echoes Breach Executable activity weekly challenge.
  4. Forgesafe I : Focus pieces of Seasonal armor at Failsafe in the H.E.L.M.
  5. Deepest Bass : Defeat 400 Vex with Void damage in Gambit or Vex Ops activities.
  6. High-Value Hunter : Defeat 150 powerful combatants in Gambit. Bonus progress for high-value targets.
  7. Momentum Crash : Defeat 50 Guardians in Momentum Control. Earn bonus progress with Zone Advantage.
  8. Classified

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : Starcrossed (Wishkeeper Exotic Combat Bow)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards.

  • Featured Raid : Deep Stone Crypt
  • Featured Dungeon : Pit of Heresy

Raid Challenges

  • Deep Stone Crypt : Of All Trades, Copies of Copies, Red Rover, The Core Four
  • Vow of the Disciple : Base Information
  • Vault of Glass : Out of Its Way
  • King's Fall : Devious Thievery
  • Root of Nightmares : Illuminated Torment
  • Garden of Salvation : A Link to the Chain
  • Last Wish : Which Witch

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

  • Weekly Crucible Modes : Momentum Control and Survival
  • Gambit - Bonus Ranks!

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Agility
  • Eclipsed Zone : Asterion Abyss
  • Empire Hunt : Phylaks, The Warrior

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Ahimsa Park
  • Campaign Mission : No Time Left
  • Partition: Ordinance

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Ghosts. Fire Pit modifier as well as Overload and Unstoppable champions.
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian: Anchor of Light
  • Wandering Nightmare: Nightmare of Jaxx, Claw of Xivu Arath (Hellmouth)
  • Campaign : A Mysterious Disturbance

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Crota (Despair)
  • Phogoth (Fear)
  • Ghaul (Rage)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : Rising - The Oracle Engine mission
  • Petra Venj Location : Divalian Mists
  • The Blind Well : Hive enemies - Plague: Cragur
  • Ascendant Challenge : Shattered Ruins through the Spine of Keres.

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Fallen
  • Round 2 : Hive
  • Final Round : Zydron

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 6/21:

  • Karnstein Armlets (Warlock gauntlets)
  • Shards of Galanor (Hunter gauntlets)
  • Armamentarium (Titan chest armor)
  • The Queenbreaker (Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Merciless (Fusion Rifle)
  • Crimson (Hand Cannon)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Acrius Catalyst
  • MIDA Multi-Tool Catalyst
  • Glimmer
  • Exotic Engram
  • Glimmer
  • Ascendant Alloy
  • Enhancement Cores
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Chroma Rush (Kinetic Auto Rifle)
  • Night Watch (Kinetic Scout Rifle)
  • Truthteller (Energy Grenade Launcher)
  • Tarnished Mettle (Energy Scout Rifle)
  • Outrageous Fortune (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Code Duello (Heavy Rocket Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Kairos Function Armor Set
  • BioSphere Explorer Helm (Titan Artifice Helm)

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards, especially for players who go flawless and earn a trip to the Lighthouse. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

Trials of Osiris details for 6/21:

  • Map : Endless Vale
  • Weapon : Aisha's Care Legendary Pulse Rifle (Adept)

item.title: Fortnite Brings Tilted Towers and Other Fan Favorite Locations, But With a Twist
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fortnite is bringing back the OG map with some major changes in the new game mode, Fortnite Reload, featuring fan-favorite locations.
  • The return of Athena Island in Season OG was a significant moment, setting a player count record of over 44 million players trying out the OG map.
  • Fortnite Reload, a new game mode based on the OG map, is set to launch on June 22 with update v30.20, along with Summer Fest.

Fortnite is once again giving players the opportunity to land on the OG map, but this time around, there are some major changes being made. For years, one of the most frequent requests among the Fortnite community was the return of the Chapter 1 map, also known as Athena Island or OG map. It got to a point where players would try to replicate it as closely as possible in Fortnite Creative. Epic Games had to step in and remove some of these islands, as they copied the company's intellectual property. It eventually caved and brought back Athena Island with the release of Fortnite Season OG.

Season OG only lasted a month, but it was one of the most significant moments in the game's history. Despite its popularity over the years, it was thanks to the release of Season OG that Fortnite reached a player count record: over 44 million players logged in to try out the OG map. While many had never landed on Athena Island before, others were brought back to experience it once again. Many gamers were sad to say goodbye to the OG locations once that season came to an end.

Despite it being removed for the second time, some players never lost hope that the Chapter 1 map would become available permanently as its own game mode, like Team Rumble, for example. Even though it has not been confirmed how long it'll be available, a new game mode based on the OG map is coming to Fortnite , and it's titled Fortnite Reload. It appears that Fortnite Reload will feature a remixed version of the Chapter 1 island with some fan-favorite Fortnite locations, such as Tilted Towers, Pleasant Park, and Retail Row. On top of that, there is a brand-new location named Sandy Sheets and a smaller version of Loot Lake named Lil' Loot Lake.

When Will Fortnite Reload Launch?

  • Saturday, June 22

The teaser is only seven seconds long, but it is clear that this version of the map is much smaller compared to the OG island. It is possible that the Battle Royale matches that will take place in Fortnite Reload won't be meant for 100 players. Before Team Rumble, there was another big teams game mode called "50 vs. 50." However, it was easier to keep this a permanent mode with fewer players, which is why Team Rumble has teams of 16 gamers competing against each other. This could support the idea that Fortnite Reload will be a permanent addition to Fortnite .

Fortnite announced that this upcoming game mode will become available on June 22, which means it's being added with update v30.20. This patch will also bring Summer Fest to Fortnite , so fans can expect a lot of fun in the month of July.

item.title: Project Orion Needs its Own Cyberpunk 2077 'Machine Gun' Quest
item.description:
Highlights

  • Cyberpunk 2077 is complete post-update, and its sequel, Project Orion, is now entering early development.
  • Fans could see Project Orion expand on unique quests like the "Machine Gun" mission with amusing AI weapons.
  • CD Projekt Red could introduce more AI-enhanced weapons like Skippy in Project Orion for added fun and charm.

Cyberpunk 2077 's story is now complete in all senses, having come full circle since its 2020 launch. In the wake of its initial release, Cyberpunk 2077 experienced at times near unprecedented levels of backlash, mainly due to its technical state on older generation platforms as well as for missing some key features and elements that were originally promised. Developer CD Projekt Red took responsibility for these shortcomings, and by the latter half of 2023, via the 2.0 update combined with The Phantom Liberty DLC, had transitioned the title into a stable and satisfactory state.

Now that Cyberpunk 2077 's development is officially concluded, with no additional content planned, CDPR is beginning early work on its sequel, currently known as Project Orion. Though it will likely still be a while before further details about it are revealed, fans are already speculating on how it will build on Cyberpunk 2077 's mechanics and themes. CP 2077 's breadth of quests spanned the tonal range from deadly serious to slapstick absurdity, and one of the standout side missions falling more into the latter category was the "Machine Gun" quest, wherein fans could befriend an AI-enhanced weapon with a strong will of its own. As a memorable inclusion, Project Orion should seek to have another mission in this same vein.

A recent leak revealed information about an allegedly canceled Cyberpunk 2077 expansion , which may provide insight into some of the other ideas that CDPR had in mind and that might potentially resurface in Project Orion.

Cyberpunk 2077's 'Machine Gun' Quest Needs its Own Version in Project Orion

Cyberpunk 2077's 'Machine Gun' Mission and Skippy

While exploring the seedy back alleys of Night City, players can discover and encounter Cyberpunk 2077 's Skippy, an AI-enhanced Smart pistol with a unique personality and related mechanic. Upon picking up the gun, a holographic projection of an animated bullet, Skippy, will cheerily greet protagonist V and ask which of two modes they would like to set the weapon in. If "Stone Cold Killer" is selected as the initial setting, Skippy's smart bullets will go for deadly accurate headshots on enemies. Meanwhile, "Puppy-Loving Pacifist" aims for limbs in a less lethal approach.

However, once players rack up 50 kills or incapacitated foes, Skippy will decide on its own to switch to the opposite setting and remain there. It's a highly entertaining and unexpected turn, showing off the fun details of the world and providing players with a unique armament in the process. Fans can also return Skippy to its original owner, officer Regina Jones, for an alternate reward should they feel his constant chatter is too much to handle or are unhappy with the mode he's stuck himself in.

How Project Orion Could Include a 'Machine Gun' Styled Quest

With it being such a distinctive quest, "Machine Gun" is ripe for potential expansion and iteration in Project Orion. The concept of a sentient talking weapon that independently decides its level of lethality aligns perfectly with genre sensibilities, and Skippy's particular brand adds great charm and humor contrasted against some of the more dour aspects in Cyberpunk 2077 . Whether Cyberpunk 2077 's sequel moves to another location or remains in Night City, it could easily include Skippy again or have more weapons like it that inject a similar flavor to the story and setting.

Any of the arms manufacturers in Cyberpunk 2077 's universe could produce another gun like Skippy, or perhaps even multiple versions of it, offering a collection of unique and powerful weapons, each of which could have an exaggerated and entertaining AI personality alongside multiple firing modes. Another approach could be for CD Projekt Red to overhaul the crafting system in Project Orion, allowing players to possibly create their own personalized homemade versions of weapons like Skippy, and upgrading them as they go along, resulting in a valuable piece of equipment that also serves as a sort of companion. Whatever other directions Project Orion takes, it would be an excellent inclusion to see a Skippy-like weapon crop up again.
